# HyperCode Community Code of Conduct üíô

**We're neurodivergent. We're different. We're here to stay.**

---

## Our Pledge

We are committed to providing a **welcoming, inclusive, and supportive** community for ALL neurodivergent developers, allies, and everyone in between.

HyperCode is built BY neurodivergent brains FOR neurodivergent brains. That means:

‚úÖ **We celebrate different thinking styles**  
‚úÖ **We honor all neurodivergences** (ADHD, autism, dyslexia, dyscalculia, etc.)  
‚úÖ **We reject ableism** in all forms  
‚úÖ **We embrace slow productivity** (hyperfocus and burnout are both valid)  
‚úÖ **We don't shame anyone** for how their brain works  

---

## Expected Behavior

### In Code & Comments
- ‚úÖ Be kind in code reviews
- ‚úÖ Explain criticism constructively
- ‚úÖ Celebrate learning moments
- ‚úÖ Share knowledge generously
- ‚úÖ Assume good intent

### In Discussions & Issues
- ‚úÖ Listen to understand, not to respond
- ‚úÖ Make space for quiet voices
- ‚úÖ Use plain language when possible
- ‚úÖ Provide context when needed
- ‚úÖ No gatekeeping‚Äîeveryone belongs

### In Our Community
- ‚úÖ Welcome new contributors enthusiastically
- ‚úÖ Be patient (some days are harder than others)
- ‚úÖ Celebrate all contributions, big & small
- ‚úÖ Support each other's boundaries
- ‚úÖ Default to kindness

---

## What We Don't Tolerate

‚ùå **Ableism**: Language like "broken brain," "high-functioning," "you don't look autistic"  
‚ùå **Gatekeeping**: "Real programmers know X," "you're not qualified"  
‚ùå **Shame**: Making anyone feel bad for:
- Coding style
- Speed of work
- Mental health needs
- Taking breaks
- Asking for help

‚ùå **Discrimination**: Based on race, gender, sexuality, disability, neurodivergence, or any identity  
‚ùå **Harassment**: Threats, targeting, or bullying of any kind  
‚ùå **Exclusion**: Deliberately leaving people out  

---

## Specific Neurodivergent Considerations

### For ADHD Community Members
‚úÖ Hyperfocus bursts are valid work patterns  
‚úÖ Task-switching isn't laziness  
‚úÖ Interruptions are hard‚Äîrespect focus time  
‚úÖ Documentation is appreciated but don't demand perfection  

### For Autistic Community Members
‚úÖ Direct communication is appreciated  
‚úÖ Logic-first explanations help  
‚úÖ Consistency matters  
‚úÖ Small talk isn't required  

### For Dyslexic Community Members
‚úÖ Font choices matter (dyslexia-friendly fonts available)  
‚úÖ Spelling errors don't mean stupidity  
‚úÖ Visual vs. text-heavy documentation both work  
‚úÖ Grammar-shaming isn't acceptable  

### For Everyone
‚úÖ Burnout is real‚Äîpace matters  
‚úÖ Some days are harder than others  
‚úÖ Stimming/fidgeting is okay  
‚úÖ Boundaries are respected  
‚úÖ Masking isn't required  

---

## If Something Goes Wrong

### You Experienced Harm
1. **You're safe here.** We believe you.
2. **Document it** (screenshot/note what happened)
3. **Report it** to conduct@hypercode.dev
4. **We'll respond** within 48 hours
5. **We'll take action** (always)

### We'll Handle:
- Private, confidential conversations
- No retaliation, ever
- Clear next steps
- Your choice of resolution

### Examples of When to Report
- Someone said something discriminatory
- Harassment or bullying happened
- Gatekeeping or exclusion
- Ableist language
- Any behavior that made you feel unsafe

---

## Consequences

**We take violations seriously.**

### First Violation
- Private conversation with person
- Clear explanation of why it was wrong
- Opportunity to learn & do better
- Path to redemption

### Repeated Violations
- Warning issued
- Temporary muting/ban from discussions
- Public acknowledgment if appropriate

### Severe Violations
- Immediate removal from community
- No path to return
- Examples: threats, harassment, hate speech

---

## Marginalizations & Power

**We acknowledge power dynamics.**

If you hold privilege (neurotypicality, race, gender, etc.) in our community, use it responsibly:

‚úÖ Amplify voices that get silenced  
‚úÖ Step back when needed  
‚úÖ Ask "Is this mine to say?"  
‚úÖ Listen to feedback  
‚úÖ Don't center your experience  

---

## Mental Health & Burnout

**We recognize that our community includes people experiencing mental health challenges.**

### We Support
‚úÖ Taking breaks when needed  
‚úÖ Saying "I need to step back"  
‚úÖ Reducing contribution when overwhelmed  
‚úÖ Seeking professional help  
‚úÖ Being honest about capacity  

### We Don't Support
‚ùå Pushing through burnout  
‚ùå Shame for stepping back  
‚ùå Pressure to "prove" you're struggling  
‚ùå "Just think positive" advice  
‚ùå Ableist productivity culture  

**If you're struggling**: [Mental health resources](./MENTAL_HEALTH.md) (coming soon)

---

## Accessibility

**We're committed to accessibility.**

### Current Commitments
‚úÖ ADHD-friendly docs (short sections, examples)  
‚úÖ Dyslexia-friendly fonts in code samples  
‚úÖ High contrast mode options  
‚úÖ Alt text on all images  
‚úÖ Captions on videos (coming)  
‚úÖ Clear, jargon-free language  

### Feedback Loop
If something isn't accessible:
1. Tell us
2. We'll listen
3. We'll make it better
4. We'll do better going forward

---

## Continuous Improvement

**This Code of Conduct isn't perfect, and neither are we.**

We'll:
- ‚úÖ Review it every 6 months
- ‚úÖ Ask the community for input
- ‚úÖ Adapt based on needs
- ‚úÖ Admit when we get things wrong
- ‚úÖ Do better

**Have feedback?** [Discuss here](https://github.com/welshDog/hypercode/discussions)

---

## Resources

- [Report a violation](https://github.com/welshDog/hypercode/discussions/report)
- [Contributor Covenant](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/) (our inspiration)
- [ADHD resources](./resources/ADHD.md) (coming)
- [Autism resources](./resources/AUTISM.md) (coming)
- [Dyslexia resources](./resources/DYSLEXIA.md) (coming)

---

## Questions?

**Confused about something?** [Ask us](https://github.com/welshDog/hypercode/discussions)

**Want to help improve this?** [We'd love your input](https://github.com/welshDog/hypercode/discussions)

**In crisis?** 
- üåç International: [Find help](https://findahelpline.com)
- üá∫üá∏ US: 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline)
- üá¨üáß UK: 116 123 (Samaritans)

---

## Bottom Line

> **We're here to build a community where neurodivergent minds are honored, celebrated, and safe.**

**Your differences aren't a bug. They're the feature that makes this community powerful.**

Welcome. We're glad you're here. üíô

---

*This Code of Conduct applies to all HyperCode spaces:*
- *GitHub repository & discussions*
- *Discord server (coming)*
- *Conferences & meetups*
- *All official communications*
